description.narrative: The Alliance consists of the Global Partnership for the Prevention of Armed Conflict (GPPAC) network , and the two networks coordinated by the World Federalist Movement-Institute for Global Policy (WFM-IGP) – the Coalition for the International Criminal Court (CICC) and the International Coalition for the Responsibility to Protect (ICRtoP). Each of the networks in the alliance has a global Secretariat, as well as regional secretariats (GPPAC) and regional hubs (WFM-IGP) hosted by other CSOs. The global and regional secretariats/hubs play a convening role: connecting members with one another or with governmental and other actors where relevant at the regional and local levels.

title.narrative: Regional Steering Group meetings organised in 6 GPPAC Regions that are part of the Prevention up Front Alliance project

description.narrative: In each of the Regional Focus Areas of the Prevention up Front Alliance there was organised a Regional Steering Group meeting in 2017 for the Regional GPPAC networks. The 6 GPPAC Regional networks in the focus areas of the PuF Alliance have an own functioning governance - that is the Regional Steering Group (RSG). Altogether there were 6 RSG meetings organised in 2017.

title.narrative: Global Strategy Group (GSG) Meeting March 27-28 to develop a new GPPAC 5-year strategic plan

description.narrative: On 27-28 March 2019, GPPAC convened a Global Strategy Group (GSG) meeting with 7 CSO members from around the globe, to collect input and recommendations from the GSG to develop the new GPPAC strategic plan 2021-2025. The GSG discussed the results of GPPAC’s mid-term review and the guidance it provides for the next strategic period for discussion at GPPAC International Steering Group meeting in May 2019.
The Alliance contributes to enhanced civil society credibility by strengthening its networks' and members' accountability, complementarities and internal procedures and practices

title.narrative: Interventions by the Global Secretariat to have the GPPAC global and Regional networks functioning effectively

description.narrative: Several activities in 2017 have contributed to this overall output, namely: - new Global Strategy Group was set up with members from the GPPAC membership; - election of new Regional Representative for East and Central African GPPAC Region; - gathered input on national GPPAC networks, to be agreed by the GPPAC International Steering Group and added as a chapter to the Network Strengthening strategy of GPPAC; - included self-assessments for the 6 Prevention up Front Regional Networks of GPPAC and review of the Memorandum of Understanding in 2017 reporting by the 6 priority Regions of GPPAC; - drafting steps towards improved governance and democracy in the network, to be discussed by the International Steering Group of GPPAC in June 2018; - agreed on transitions of the Regional Secretariats of the Regional GPPAC networks in East and Central Africa, Latin America and Caribbean and West Africa.

title.narrative: Preparatory work for and commitment of GPPAC members to participate in the key network governance bodies GSG and ISG

description.narrative: The Global Strategy Group advises GPPAC and its networks at the strategic level. It will meet - as successor of the Programme Steering Group - in The Hague in April 2018 for the first time. All the necessary discussion documents were drafted in 2018-I. Travel arrangement for the International Steering Group - GPPAC's highest decision making body - to meet early June in Sri Lanka were started. It provides an indication of the commitment of ISG members to meet and participate.

title.narrative: GPPAC held an International Steering Group Meeting on 4-6 June 2018 in Colombo, Sri Lanka.

description.narrative: The participants were representing all of GPPAC’s regions (with the exception of Central Asia). The International Steering Group took decisions on network governance issues, strategic planning, advocacy, knowledge production, inclusivity and communications; and advised on a number of issues including network membership, protecting civic space, and gender (including amendments to the GPPAC Charter on gender). The GPPAC Global Secretariat convened, coordinated and funded the meeting.
3.2.2. The networks and members develop internal procedures to strengthen internal (network) and external accountability and take steps to implement them.

title.narrative: GPPAC held a Global Strategy Group meeting on 10-11 April 2018 in The Hague, The Netherlands.

description.narrative: The participants were the Chairs of the GPPAC Working Groups from Mexico, the Philippines, Palestine, Serbia, Sri Lanka, and the USA. The GSG provided a great deal of input on various GPPAC strategies, programmes and network issues. The Global Secretariat wrote a report capturing the discussions and recommendations from the GSG meeting, as well as several discussion documents for the ISG. The GPPAC Global Secretariat convened, coordinated and funded the meeting.
3.2.2. The networks and members develop internal procedures to strengthen internal (network) and external accountability and take steps to implement them.
